name: Internally displaced people (IDP) by country or territory of asylum / origin
valueInfo: A high number of internally displaced people suggests internal conflict or disasters within a country.

name: Net migration
valueInfo: Net migration reflects the balance between people entering and leaving a country, indicating economic and social conditions.

name: Other people in need of international protection by country or territory of asylum
valueInfo: The number of people needing protection in a country can reflect its humanitarian policies and international obligations.

name: Other people in need of international protection by country or territory of origin
valueInfo: A high number of people needing protection from a country may indicate severe human rights issues.

name: Refugees under the mandate of the UNHCR by country or territory of asylum
valueInfo: The number of UNHCR refugees in a country can indicate its role in international refugee protection efforts.

name: Refugees under the mandate of the UNHCR by country or territory of origin
valueInfo: A high number of UNHCR refugees originating from a country may indicate severe conflict or persecution.

name: Refugees under the mandate of the UNRWA by country or territory of asylum
valueInfo: The number of UNRWA refugees in a country reflects its involvement in supporting Palestinian refugees.

name: Refugees under the mandate of the UNRWA by country or territory of origin
valueInfo: A high number of UNRWA refugees originating from a region indicates ongoing displacement issues among Palestinians.

name: International migrant stock, total
valueInfo: The total number of international migrants reflects global migration trends and a country's attractiveness or push factors.

name: International migrant stock (% of population)
valueInfo: Represents the percentage of the population that is composed of international migrants. A higher percentage can indicate a diverse society but may also reflect economic or political challenges.

name: Prevalence of undernourishment (% of population)
valueInfo: Indicates the percentage of the population that is undernourished. A lower value is better, reflecting better food security and nutrition.

name: Prevalence of moderate or severe food insecurity in the population (%)
valueInfo: Shows the percentage of the population experiencing moderate or severe food insecurity. Lower values are preferable as they indicate better food access.

name: Consumption of iodized salt (% of households)
valueInfo: Represents the percentage of households consuming iodized salt, crucial for preventing iodine deficiency disorders.

name: Prevalence of severe food insecurity in the population (%)
valueInfo: Reflects the percentage of the population facing severe food insecurity. Lower values are better, indicating improved food security.

name: Vitamin A supplementation coverage rate (% of children ages 6-59 months)
valueInfo: Shows the percentage of children receiving Vitamin A supplements, important for preventing deficiencies and supporting immune function.

name: Adolescent fertility rate (births per 1,000 women ages 15-19)
valueInfo: Indicates the number of births per 1,000 women aged 15-19. Lower rates are often associated with better education and health outcomes for young women.

name: Mortality rate, adult, female (per 1,000 female adults)
valueInfo: Represents the mortality rate of adult females. Lower values indicate better health and healthcare access for women.

name: Mortality rate, adult, male (per 1,000 male adults)
valueInfo: Represents the mortality rate of adult males. Lower values indicate better health and healthcare access for men.

name: Birth rate, crude (per 1,000 people)
valueInfo: Indicates the number of live births per 1,000 people. It reflects population growth trends but does not directly indicate good or bad performance.

name: Death rate, crude (per 1,000 people)
valueInfo: Shows the number of deaths per 1,000 people. Lower rates are generally better, indicating improved health and longevity.

name: Contraceptive prevalence, any modern method (% of married women ages 15-49)
valueInfo: Represents the percentage of married women using modern contraceptive methods. Higher values indicate better family planning and reproductive health services.

name: Contraceptive prevalence, any method (% of married women ages 15-49)
valueInfo: Shows the percentage of married women using any contraceptive method. Higher values suggest better access to family planning.

name: Mortality rate, infant, female (per 1,000 live births)
valueInfo: Indicates the mortality rate of female infants. Lower values are better, reflecting improved healthcare and living conditions.

name: Mortality rate, infant (per 1,000 live births)
valueInfo: Represents the mortality rate of infants. Lower values are preferable, indicating better healthcare and living conditions.

name: Mortality rate, infant, male (per 1,000 live births)
valueInfo: Indicates the mortality rate of male infants. Lower values are better, reflecting improved healthcare and living conditions.

name: Life expectancy at birth, female (years)
valueInfo: Shows the average number of years a newborn female is expected to live. Higher values indicate better health and living conditions.

name: Life expectancy at birth, total (years)
valueInfo: Represents the average number of years a newborn is expected to live. Higher values indicate better health and living conditions.

name: Life expectancy at birth, male (years)
valueInfo: Shows the average number of years a newborn male is expected to live. Higher values indicate better health and living conditions.

name: Fertility rate, total (births per woman)
valueInfo: Indicates the average number of children a woman would have. It reflects population growth trends but does not directly indicate good or bad performance.

name: Survival to age 65, female (% of cohort)
valueInfo: A higher percentage indicates better health and living conditions for women.

name: Survival to age 65, male (% of cohort)
valueInfo: A higher percentage suggests improved health and living conditions for men.

name: Wanted fertility rate (births per woman)
valueInfo: Reflects the number of children women desire to have, indicating family planning and societal norms.

name: Female headed households (% of households with a female head)
valueInfo: Shows the proportion of households led by women, reflecting gender roles and economic independence.

name: Women who were first married by age 15 (% of women ages 20-24)
valueInfo: A lower percentage is better, indicating reduced child marriage and improved women's rights.

name: Women who were first married by age 18 (% of women ages 20-24)
valueInfo: A lower percentage suggests progress in delaying marriage age, enhancing women's opportunities.

name: Teenage mothers (% of women ages 15-19 who have had children or are currently pregnant)

valueInfo: Indicates the annual percentage increase in the urban population. A balanced growth rate is often seen as positive for sustainable urban development.

valueInfo: The total number of people living in urban areas. A higher urban population can indicate urbanization trends and economic development.

valueInfo: The percentage of the total population living in urban areas. A higher percentage often correlates with industrialization and economic growth.

valueInfo: The percentage of married women aged 15-49 who want to stop or delay childbearing but are not using contraception. Lower values indicate better access to reproductive health services.

valueInfo: The number of international tourists arriving in a country. Higher numbers can indicate a thriving tourism industry.

name: International tourism, number of departures
valueInfo: The number of residents traveling abroad. Higher numbers can reflect a country's economic prosperity and citizens' mobility.

valueInfo: The total revenue generated from international tourism. Higher receipts indicate a strong tourism sector.

name: International tourism, receipts (% of total exports)
valueInfo: The percentage of total exports that come from tourism receipts. A higher percentage indicates a significant reliance on tourism for foreign exchange.

name: International tourism, receipts for passenger transport items (current US$)
valueInfo: Revenue from international tourism related to passenger transport. Higher values suggest a robust transport sector within tourism.

valueInfo: Expenditures by residents on international passenger transport. Lower values can indicate cost-effective travel options.

name: International tourism, receipts for travel items (current US$)

name: International tourism, expenditures for travel items (current US$)

name: International tourism, expenditures (current US$)

name: Merchandise trade (% of GDP)

name: Tariff rate, most favored nation, simple mean, manufactured products (%)

name: Tariff rate, most favored nation, weighted mean, manufactured products (%)

commonName: Tariff Lines with International Peaks for Primary Products

name: Share of tariff lines with specific rates, primary products (%)
commonName: Specific Tariff Rates for Primary Products

valueInfo: Higher percentages indicate a focus on tech and communication services.

valueInfo: Represents the total value of commercial services exported.

name: High-technology exports (current US$)
valueInfo: Higher values indicate a strong high-tech export sector.

name: High-technology exports (% of manufactured exports)
valueInfo: Shows the proportion of high-tech goods in total manufactured exports.

name: Transport services (% of commercial service exports)
valueInfo: Indicates the share of transport services in commercial exports.

name: Travel services (% of commercial service exports)
valueInfo: Reflects the importance of travel services in commercial exports.

name: Voice and Accountability: Estimate
valueInfo: Higher values suggest better governance and citizen participation.

name: Voice and Accountability: Number of Sources
valueInfo: Indicates the number of sources used to estimate governance quality.

name: Voice and Accountability: Percentile Rank
valueInfo: A higher percentile rank indicates better governance and accountability.

name: Voice and Accountability: Percentile Rank, Lower Bound of 90% Confidence Interval
valueInfo: Indicates the lower bound of a country's ability to allow citizens to participate in selecting their government, freedom of expression, and media freedom.

name: Voice and Accountability: Percentile Rank, Upper Bound of 90% Confidence Interval
valueInfo: Indicates the upper bound of a country's ability to allow citizens to participate in selecting their government, freedom of expression, and media freedom.

name: Voice and Accountability: Standard Error
valueInfo: Measures the statistical accuracy of the Voice and Accountability indicator, with lower values indicating more precise estimates.

name: Battle-related deaths (number of people)
valueInfo: Reflects the number of deaths due to conflicts, with lower values indicating a more peaceful environment.

name: Internally displaced persons, new displacement associated with conflict and violence (number of cases)
valueInfo: Represents the number of people displaced due to conflict and violence, with lower values indicating better stability.

name: Internally displaced persons, new displacement associated with disasters (number of cases)
valueInfo: Represents the number of people displaced due to natural disasters, with lower values indicating better disaster management.

name: Intentional homicides, female (per 100,000 female)
valueInfo: Indicates the rate of intentional homicides among females, with lower values indicating a safer environment for women.

name: Intentional homicides, male (per 100,000 male)
valueInfo: Indicates the rate of intentional homicides among males, with lower values indicating a safer environment for men.

name: Intentional homicides (per 100,000 people)
valueInfo: Reflects the overall rate of intentional homicides, with lower values indicating a safer society.
